messages.content: Hi! My husband and I are looking to buy a house. We have two kids, ages 7 and 10.
Welcome! I'd love to help you find the perfect home for your family. Let me ask a few questions to understand what you're looking for.
Great! We're looking for something with at least 3 bedrooms, ideally 4 if we can find it, since we need space for both kids and a home office.
That makes sense. What's your budget range for this purchase?
We're looking to stay between $200,000 and $400,000. We can stretch up to maybe $420,000 for the right place.
Perfect. That gives us good options in several neighborhoods. What areas are you interested in?
We'd prefer to stay in the Westside or near good schools. Our oldest starts middle school next year.
Excellent. Schools are definitely a priority. What about outdoor space? Do you need a backyard?
Yes, a backyard is essential. The kids need space to play, and we love to host family barbecues in the summer.
Got it! I'll start looking for 3-4 bedroom homes with good yards in family-friendly neighborhoods with top-rated schools. I'll send you some listings this week.
I looked at those listings you sent. The one on Maple Street looks interesting!
The Maple Street property is lovely! It has 4 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, and a great backyard. Would you like to schedule a showing?
Yes, please! Can we see it this Saturday? My husband will be available then.
Saturday works perfectly. I've scheduled a showing for 10am. The house also has an updated kitchen which I think you'll love.
That's great! One thing though - is there parking? We have two cars.
Yes, it has a 2-car garage plus driveway space. Plenty of room for both vehicles.
Perfect. Are there any other similar properties we should look at while we're out?
I found two more in your price range nearby. One on Oak Drive with 5 bedrooms, and another on Pine Avenue with a larger lot.
The 4-bedroom sounds interesting. We could use the extra room for guests since my parents visit often.
I'll add the Oak Drive property to your Saturday tour. It's listed at $385,000 and has been on the market for just two weeks.
We saw both houses yesterday. The Maple Street one was nice but felt a bit cramped, and honestly it only has 2 bathrooms which might not be enough.
I understand. What did you think of the Oak Drive property with 4 bedrooms?
We loved the space! But honestly, it needs too much work. The kitchen is really outdated and we don't want a major renovation.
That's valuable feedback. So move-in ready or recently updated is important to you?
Exactly. We want something we can move into without major projects. Maybe cosmetic updates are fine, but no gut renovations.
Got it. Let me focus on homes that have been updated in the last 5-10 years. Any other must-haves we should add to the criteria?
A good-sized master bedroom would be great. And if it has hardwood floors, even better!
Noted! Hardwood floors are popular in this area. What about a home office space - still important?
Yes, very important. My husband works from home three days a week, so we need a dedicated office with a door. Also, I'm thinking at least 2.5 bathrooms would be ideal with the kids getting older.

Perfect. I'll search for move-in ready, 3-4 bedroom homes with at least 2.5 baths, hardwood floors, updated features, good yards, and space for a home office. I'll have new options for you by Wednesday.
The listings you sent look great! Especially the one on Birch Lane. Can we see it this week?
The Birch Lane house is stunning! It's listed at $365,000, has beautiful hardwood floors throughout, and was renovated in 2021. I can get you in Thursday at 5pm.
Thursday works! What's the school district for that property?
It's in the Riverside School District - highly rated. The elementary school is actually walkable, just 3 blocks away.
That's perfect! Our daughter could walk to school. What about the backyard size?
The lot is 0.3 acres with a fully fenced backyard. There's a patio area and plenty of grass for the kids to play.
Sounds ideal. Is there central AC? That's something we realized we need after looking at the Oak Drive house.
Yes, it has central air and heat, both updated in 2021 during the renovation. Very energy efficient.
Great. And the garage situation?
2-car attached garage with additional storage space. There's also a workshop area that your husband might appreciate.
He'll love that! We're really excited to see this one. It checks all our boxes.
I have a good feeling about this property for you! See you Thursday at 5pm.
We absolutely loved the Birch Lane house! We want to make an offer.
I'm so glad to hear that! It really is perfect for your family. The market is competitive right now, so we should move quickly.
What do you think we should offer? It's listed at $365,000.
Based on recent comps in the area, I'd recommend offering $375,000. It's a strong offer that shows you're serious without going too high.
That's a bit of a stretch but within our budget. Should we include any contingencies?
Definitely include a home inspection contingency. I'd also recommend a financing contingency since you're getting a mortgage.
Good idea. We're pre-approved up to $420,000, so financing shouldn't be an issue.
Perfect. That strengthens your position. How about the closing timeline - do you have flexibility?
Our lease ends in 60 days, so we could close anytime in the next 45-60 days.
That's ideal. Most sellers appreciate a flexible buyer. Let me draft the offer with $375,000, standard contingencies, and a 45-day close. We can present it this evening.
Let's do it! My husband and I are both so excited. This house has everything we wanted - the yard, the office, the updated kitchen, the school district, and 2.5 bathrooms.
It really does check every box! I'll get the paperwork ready and call you within the hour. Fingers crossed!
